definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The invisibility of patent is the intrinsic factor for itself to seek international protection.
sentences.chinese: 专利自身的无形性是其寻求国际保护的内在动因。

sentences.english: The second part is at the end of the checking news legislation history agent summary and the summary.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分是对清末新闻立法历史动因的总结和概括。

sentences.english: Death terror is one of the psychology reasons that Western Han Fu Jia is anxious about life.
sentences.chinese: 死亡恐惧是西汉赋家生命焦虑的心理动因之一。

sentences.english: From bullying to drug use, we will explorethe motives of why kids turn to dangerous behavior.
sentences.chinese: 从涉毒这个角度，我们将探讨孩童们变坏的动因。

sentences.english: The cost driver of cooperation cost lies on compositive variables.
sentences.chinese: 协同成本的动因在于联产品的组成变量。

sentences.english: Teachers are change agents, providing the impetus for the emergence of educated communities.
sentences.chinese: 教师是变革的动因，他们推动了有教养社会的形成。

sentences.english: Zeng Ming, this is split Taobao motivation.
sentences.chinese: 曾鸣说，这是拆分淘宝的动因。

sentences.english: Then, what is the motive of Geyi by Nestorianism?
sentences.chinese: 那么，景教“格义”的动因何在？

sentences.english: The exploring spirit is the valuable motive for artistic creation.
sentences.chinese: 探索精神是艺术创作的可贵动因。

sentences.english: The cost rate is the cost per cost driver.
sentences.chinese: 成本分配率是指单位成本动因应负担的成本。

definition: to originate from/to come from the fact that/owing to/because of
same as 總而言之|总而言之[zong3 er2 yan2 zhi1]
in simple terms/to put things simply/briefly
to induce/to promote/to urge/to impel/to bring about/to provoke/to drive (sb to do sth)/to catalyze/to actuate/to contribute to (some development)
to trace something to its source (idiom)
